page.title: 09BIRCHWOOD HALL
page.content:
{ { A VICTORIAN COUNTRY HOUSE
Birchwood Hall is a large, imposing edifice occupying a site with splendid views of the north and west. It was built for the Mayor of Worcester in 1850 and has 27 rooms. It now houses a commune of eleven adults and four children in the main house and in the converted outbuildings. The occupants are professional people who have chosen to live in this style because of their wish to lead a co-operative life in a country setting. Each family has private accommodation, with shared rooms for leisure activities. There is a rota system for housework and cooking in which all share.
